meanings.def: to continue to exist for longer than expected
examples: The faint smell of her perfume lingered in the room.
linger on The civil war lingered on well into the 1930s.
It will linger forever in the minds of many people.
The feelings of hurt and resentment lingered on for years.

meanings.def: to stay somewhere for longer because you do not want to leave; to spend a long time doing something
examples: She lingered for a few minutes to talk to Nick.
We lingered over breakfast on the terrace.

meanings.def: to continue to look at somebody/something or think about something for longer than usual
examples: His eyes lingered on the diamond ring on her finger.

meanings.def: to stay alive but become weaker
examples: He lingered on for several months after the heart attack.
